en: God knows that human beings are not meant to live alone.
He creates companionship so that life is shared, supported, and complete.

lines: The Lord God said,
“It is not good for the man to be alone.
I will make a helper suitable for him.”
The Lord God caused the man to fall into a deep sleep.
While he slept,
God took one of the man’s ribs
and closed the place with flesh.
From the rib He had taken,
the Lord God made a woman
and brought her to the man.
The man said,
“This is now bone of my bones
and flesh of my flesh.
She shall be called woman,
for she was taken out of man.”
For this reason,
a man will leave his father and mother
and be united to his wife,
and they will become one flesh.
The man and his wife were both naked,
and they felt no shame.

question.en: What does this passage show about how God intends human beings to live together?
